name: Mithas
text: If Mithas is razed, it is automatically rebuilt at the beginning of its player's next turn. If Mithas is attacked a second time while it is razed, it is discarded.

name: Silvanesti
text: Any elf (champion or ally) defending Silvanesti gains 2 levels.

name: Goodland
text: Any kender or gnome (champion or ally) defending Goodland gains 2 levels.

name: Khur
text: Khur can defend itself as a level 4 hero.

name: Solamnia
text: If Solamnia is razed, the attacker must discard his hand (including his victory card, if not playable), shuffle his discard pile into his deck, and draw a new hand of 5 cards.

name: Sancrist
text: Any Dragonlance champion defending Sancrist gains 2 levels.

name: Northern Ergoth
text: Any cleric defending Northern Ergoth gains 3 levels.

name: Southern Ergoth
text: Any elf (champion or ally) attacking Southern Ergoth loses 2 levels.

name: Plains of Dust
text: Any champion attacking the Plains of Dust loses 2 levels.

name: Spine of Taladas
text: This realm can only be attacked by flyers or swimmers.

name: Isle of Selasia
text: This realm can only be attacked by flyers or swimmers.

name: Thorin
text: Any dwarf (champion or ally) defending Thorin gains 2 levels; any dwarf attacking loses 2 levels.

name: Reorxcrown Mountains
text: This realm can only be attacked by flyers or dwarves and is immune to offensive wizard spells.

name: Tower of Wayreth
text: The attached realm cannot be attacked by wizards. At the beginning of this player's turn, this holding must shift to another realm or be discarded.

name: The Lost Citadel
text: Any wizard defending the attached realm gains 2 levels; any wizard attacking loses 2 levels.

name: Shoikan Grove
text: Only flyers or earth-walkers can attack the attached realm.

name: Inn of the Last Home
text: The attached realm cannot be attacked by dragons.

name: Altar of Mishakal
text: Any dwarf (champion or ally) who is defeated while defending or attacking the attached realm is not discarded but reshuffled into its deck.

name: Skie, Blue Dragon
text: Flyer. The first ally played with Skie is treated as a flyer.

name: Governor Erann Flowstone
text: Dwarf.

name: Tika Waylan Majere
text: If defending a realm that has the holding Inn of the Last Home attached to it, Tika gains 3 levels.

name: Lord Gunthar, Solamnic Knight
text: If used to defend a realm, Lord Gunthar gains 2 levels.

name: Maquesta Kar-Thon
text: Maquesta gains 4 levels when attacking a realm that has a coast.

name: Ladonna, Wizard of the Black Robes
text: Ladonna is level 7 if she is played from 6 PM to midnight. If the Moon Nuitari Waxes event card is in play, all spells cast by her gain 2 levels.

name: Justarian, Wizard of the Red Robes
text: Justarian is level 8 if he is played from 6 PM to dawn. If the Moon Lunitari Waxes event card is in play, all spells cast by him gain 2 levels.

name: Dargent, Silver Dragon
text: Flyer. Dargent can cast wizard and cleric spells. The first ally played with him is treated as a flyer.

name: Raistlin Majere, Wizard of the Black Robes
text: Raistlin gains 2 levels if played from 7 PM to 2 AM; he gains 4 levels if pitted against Caramon. If the Moon Nuitari Waxes event card is in play, his spells gain 2 levels.

name: Fizban the Fabulous
text: Fizban can also cast cleric spells. He can only defend, never attack. All spells cast by him are at the level of the card's last digit.

name: Takhisis, Queen of Darkness
text: Takhisis can cast wizard spells if she is played 6 PM to dawn. She can only attack, never defend.

name: Par-Salian, Wizard of the White Robes
text: Par-Salian is level 10 if he is played from dawn to 6 PM. If the Moon Solinari Waxes event card is in play, all spells cast by him gain 2 levels.

name: Pyrite, the Ancient Gold Dragon
text: Flyer. Pyrite can cast wizard and cleric spells. The first ally placed with him is treated as a flyer.

name: Tanis Half-Elven
text: Tanis gains 3 levels if defending a Dragonlance realm. He is not subject to adjustments applied to elves.

name: Flint Fireforge
text: Dwarf. Flint has the earth-walking ability, letting him strike at any realm.

name: Caramon Majere
text: Caramon can inspire allies, adding +3 to a single ally or adding +1 to all his allies. Must decide when first ally is played.

name: Tasslehoff Burrfoot
text: Kender. Each turn, Tasslehoff can either retrieve any magical item from this player's discard pile or rearrange the magical items held by heroes in his pool.

name: Phudge, the Great Highbulp
text: Dwarf. Because attacking champions always underestimate Phudge, they lose 2 levels if he defends a Dragonlance realm.

name: Gully Dwarves
text: Become +5 if allied with any dwarf champion.

name: Night of the Eye
text: Played at the beginning of the player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until any other rule card is played. Up to three Dragonlance event cards remain in effect at any given time. If a fourth Dragonlance event card is played, that player chooses which Dragonlance event it replaces.

name: Krynn Minotaurs
text: Become +9 if allied with Kaz the Minotaur. Can be kept in the player's pool with Kaz until used in battle; discard after use.

name: Solamnic Knights
text: Become +4 if used to defend a Dragonlance realm. Become +5 if allied with Lord Gunthar.

name: Brine Dragon
text: Swimmer. One enemy ally (this player's choice) is swallowed by the brine dragon, instantly defeated.

name: Kagonesti Elves
text: Wild elves.

name: Dimernesti Elves
text: Swimmer. Sea elves. If this player's champion is a swimmer, the elves can switch the attack to any other coastal realm. Nonswimming attacking allies are discarded.

name: Sivak Draconians
text: Can be a +4 ally or can assume the level and ability of a single opposing ally.

name: Kapak Draconians
text: Become +5 if played from dawn to 6 PM. Kapaks turn to acid if defeated, destroying any player's lead holding.

name: Aurak Draconians
text: When played, this player can look at the top three cards in any opponent's deck. Auraks explode if defeated, sending the opposing champion to its discard pile.

name: Dragonlance
text: Usable only by heroes, the Dragonlance is +7 vs. dragon champions.

name: Staff of Magius
text: Usable only by wizards.

name: Shield of Huma
text: The attached champion must be defeated twice when defending before being discarded. Dragon champions lose 3 levels if attacking this champion.

name: The Nightjewel
text: The attached champion can ignore the effects of up to three spells per battle if played from 6 PM to dawn or two spells if from dawn to 6 PM.

name: Hammer of Kharas
text: The hammer is +7 if wielded by a dwarf.

name: Blamblower
text: This gnomish invention explodes after one use and is discarded. It sends at least 6 levels of enemy champions and allies (opponent's choice) to the discard pile. (Off)

name: Irongnome
text: A champion wearing this gnomish invention ignores attacks from all magical weapons. (Def)

name: Bupu's Emerald
text: Usable only by dwarves, gnomes, kender, and halflings, the emerald works only against monsters. (Def)

name: Inflatable Flotilla
text: This gnomish invention cannot be used the turn it is first played. A champion and all allies can attack a coastal realm, each gaining 2 levels. They are treated as swimmers. No effect on landbound realms (Off)

name: Brooch of Imog
text: Usable only by wizards, the brooch creates a shield surrounding the champion, allowing him to ignore the effect of one spell per battle. (Def)

name: Solamnic Armor
text: All attacking champions and allies are lowered in level by 1 or by 3 if the armor is worn by Lord Gunthar. (Def)

name: Dalamar's Ring of Healing
text: At the end of every other turn, the player can bring one wizard from his discard pile and place that card on top of his draw pile. (Def)

name: Wand of Telekinesis
text: Each turn, this player can send one of his opponent's magical items to the discard pile. (Off)

name: Flute of Wind Dancing
text: Creates a strong force of wind, keeping at least 6 levels of allies (opponent's choice) out of a battle. (Off)

name: Dagger of Night
text: The dagger is +4 if played from 6 PM to dawn. It gains an additional +1 for each Moon Waxes event card in play. (Off)

name: Time Shift: Night into Day
text: If played 6 PM to dawn, it is now considered day. This spell reverses the effect of a day into night card. Remains in effect until countered or dispelled. (Def/3)

name: Time Shift: Day into Night
text: If played from dawn to 6 PM, it is now considered night. This spell reverses the effect of a night into day card. Remains in effect until countered or dispelled. (Def/3)

name: Antimagic Barrier
text: Champion can ignore all spells and magical items used by an opponent for one round of battle. (Def/4)

name: Unnerving Aura
text: An opponent's champion loses its nerve in battle. It must return to its pool and is considered defeated. (Off/4)

name: Strength
text: (Off/4)

name: Steel
text: Adds +2 to all magical swords, axes, spears, and hammers on this player's side for all battles played in a single turn. (Off/3)

name: Moonlight Madness
text: If played from 6 PM to dawn, this spell reduces an opponent's champions and allies by 2 levels for one battle. (Off/3)

name: Switch
text: When attacking, this player can switch his champion with another champion from either his pool or his discard pile. (Off/4)

name: Recall
text: All spells in this player's discard pile are returned to his deck and reshuffled. (Def/3/5)

name: Tenser's Transformation
text: The wizard who casts this becomes a level 9 hero for one round. He can still cast wizard spells. (Off/3)

name: Charm Monster
text: From 1 to 6 levels of an opponent's allies join this player's side (caster's choice). (Off/3)

name: Fire Rain
text: All flyers (champions and allies) lose 2 levels. (Off/4)

name: Stone Water
text: Swimmers are held in place, preventing them from attacking or defending. (Off/3)

name: Protection from Draconians
text: Champion is +2 against draconians and is immune to their effects when defeated. (Off/4)

name: Mishakal's Insistence
text: All champions immune to spells and magical items are now vulnerable for this player's turn. (Def/3)

name: Divine Intervention
text: This player can retrieve one champion and one ally from his discard pile, which must be put into his hand. (Def/5)

name: Summon Griffon
text: One champion and up to two allies can fly for one round. (Def/3/4)

name: Reflection
text: All spells cast at this champion by an opponent are directed back at that opponent or at any other champion (this player's choice). (Def/4)

name: Earth-Walking
text: A champion and two allies gain the ability to move through the earth, attacking any realm. (Def/3)

name: Borrow
text: Select an opponent's magical item to use with any champion this round. Return the item to the original player after use. (Def/3)

name: Despair
text: The allies of an opponent falter and do not fight this round. Any in battle return to their player's hand. (Off/4)

name: Return
text: This player's allies and magical items currently under the control of an opponent return to their original deck and are reshuffled. (Def/5)

name: Hazy Image
text: This player can withdraw his champion or one ally from a battle and return it to the top of his draw pile. He loses the round. (Def/4)

name: Peace
text: The attacking force has a change of heart. That force's magical items and spells are discarded. Champions and allies return to the opponent's pool or hand. (Off/4)

name: Double Trouble
text: Select a spell or magical item and double its effectiveness for one round. (Off/3)

name: Mishakal Intervenes
text: One Dragonlance champion or ally in each player's discard pile is returned to the top of its respective deck.

name: Habbakuk Interferes
text: The god of animal life and the seas is watching. Until the player's next turn, no coastal realm can be attacked.

name: Kiri-Jolith Arrives
text: The war god has taken an interest in the affairs of men. All nonspellcasting champions gain 3 levels until this player's next turn.

name: Reorx, the Forge, Walks the Land
text: All dwarves, gnomes, and kender (champions and allies) gain 2 levels until the end of this player's turn.

name: Morgain, God of Disease, Strikes
text: Only Dragonlance allies may be played until this player's next turn.

name: Zeboim, the Sea Queen, Is Enraged
text: Zeboim lends her might to all champions and allies attacking a coastal realm. These attackers gain 1 level until this player's next turn.

name: Bronze Dragons
text: A force of bronze dragons rallies to this player's side, preventing all attacks against his realms until his next turn.

name: Moon Solinari Waxes
text: All wizards gain 1 level until this player's next turn; wizards of the white robe gain 3 levels.

name: Moon Lunitari Waxes
text: All wizards gain 1 level until this player's next turn; wizards of the red robe gain 3 levels.

name: Moon Nuitari Waxes
text: All wizards gain 1 level until this player's next turn; wizards of the black robe gain 3 levels.

name: Call to Arms!
text: All allies of Dragonlance champions gain 3 levels until the end of this event player's next turn.

name: Axe of Brotherhood
text: The axe is a +6 weapon if the Sword of Friendship is in play anywhere. (Off)

name: Sword of Friendship
text: The sword is a +6 weapon if the Axe of Brotherhood is in play anywhere. (Off)

name: Knights of the Crown
text: Becomes a level 8 hero when fighting a monster; immune to offensive spells cast by monsters.

name: Knights of the Sword
text: Becomes a level 9 hero when fighting a wizard; immune to offensive wizard spells.

name: Knights of the Rose
text: Becomes a level 10 hero when fighting a monster; immune to offensive magical items.

name: Shield of Huma
text: Plus 2 additional levels when fighting a monster; immune to offensive spells cast by monsters. (Def)

name: Crossed Blades
text: Only heroes can attack or defend until the end of this event player's next turn.

name: Spirit of the Que-Shu
text: Defending Dragonlance champions gain 5 levels and can cast clerical spells until the end of this event player's next turn.

name: The Skull of Fistandantilus
text: Attached champion can cast wizard spells and doubles the level (number in icon) of spells he casts. Only a wizard or monster can be played in defense against the skull.

name: Takhisis's Mirror and Staff
text: Plus 2 additional levels if attached to a monster. (Off)

name: Takhisis's Mirror and Sword
text: The opponent's unmodified level (printed on the card) is halved and rounded down.

name: Takhisis's Abyssal Gateway
text: Forces any one champion in a pool to the abyss (champion is removed from game). (Off/3)

name: Takhisis's Mirror of Life Trapping
text: Place this on any champion. That card is out of play until dispel magic is cast on it.

name: Takhisis's Mirror of Underworld Minions
text: The attached champion wins a round automatically if any of the opposing force is undead.

name: Takhisis's Mirror of Revenge!
text: When the attached champion loses a round, the mirror is broken and this card becomes a level 6 monster in the owner's pool. (Def)

name: Takhisis's Mirror of the Abyssal Warlord
text: Level 10 vs. any Dragonlance champion or allies.

name: Takhisis's Helmet of Power
text: No card has immunity to anything when this mirror is in play.

name: Tower of High Sorcery
text: Played at the beginning of the player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until any other rule card is played. All wizards gain 4 levels.

name: Blessing of the Gods
text: Played at the beginning of the player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until any other rule card is played. The gods grant that all undead opposing clerics are instantly destroyed.

name: Age of Dreams
text: Played at the beginning of the player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until any other rule card is played. All monsters are immune to defensive spells and walls.

name: The Golden Age
text: Played at the beginning of the player's turn, this card is not discarded. It affects all players and remains in effect until any other rule card is played. Heroes who draw spoils of war draw two cards; the first can be treated normally, the second can only be held or discarded.

name: Haste Spell
text: For one round, the champion's original level (printed on the card) is doubled. (Def/4)

name: Flute of Wind Dancing
text: The attached champion and all allies become swimmers able to attack any realm with a visible coastline, regardless of the realm's position in the formation. (Def)

name: Medallion of Faith
text: The attached champion can cast cleric spells. The player draws one extra card per turn and increases maximum hand size by 1.
